body: +1 for the patch @sowmyaramesh.
@yzheng-hortonworks  Patch looks good. Please add IT tests for instance search of a group of entities. This should be possible under MetadataResourceJerseyIT.

@sowmyaramesh  :+1: for the patch. It is long one and I did a couple of sweeps through it.  Thank you for porting Falcon-1880 patch to server side extensions. 

Please leave a comment describing the end2end testing you did for future reference.
+1 on moving String constants to FalconCLIConstants.
Thanks @sowmyaramesh  - +1 for the patch

Thanks @sowmyaramesh.   I think we need to document making sure people upgrading are fully aware of the changes in terms of externally visible changes.   

+1
@vrangan : I keep that in mind when I update the documents. Thanks!
Thanks for catching it @bvellanki .   +1
LGTM +1
Thank you for review @vrangan  and @vramachan. I will commit this to unblock jenkins builds. If there is a cleaner way to solve the error, we will revisit the issue in future.
@PraveenAdlakha Patch looks good. +1.
Thanks for the review everyone..
If there are no any further comments, I will commit the patch soon.

Thanks for the quick review @yzheng-hortonworks . Will commit once build succeeds.

Thanks for working through this @bvellanki 

I went through the rest of the review comments.  There are some that we may not do (say '-' as a constant), but some of the other items like making a string a constant may be as simple as declaring them static final with a constant name (for example for .snapshot).

Also, logging with parameters is also consistent with rest of the code and is helpful.

When you make a new pull request you can fix some of these minor nits to enhance the code quality
Could you add tests or create a jira to add tests? Thank you.
I have applied the patch and build works fine. +1 .
I will commit this patch to avoid further build failure.
+1. Looks good.   Don't we need documentation update about the changes.   Can you follow it up in another JIRA
Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FALCON-1921 for IT tests
please update the documentation for the search option.
@vrangan I don't think so that documentation changes are required for this pull request as it is not the user level change. User will still get examples directory under $FALCON_HOME as usual.
Also just for my understanding is the code server side is already committed?
+1, LGTM. Thanks!
@vrangan @sandeepSamudrala @sowmyaramesh  : I incorporated the feedback into code and submitted updated patch. Please review
@PraveenAdlakha Thanks for review. Yes, the code for REST api was committed to apache branch this morning. Also updated the documentation for both REST api and CLI.
+1 LGTM
+1. LGTM. Will merge if no further comments.
I found a bug in the way jobConf is set for DistCP in kerberos secured environment. Fixed that issue and updated the patch. Please review and provide feedback.
👍 Ying, code looks good.
👍  for the code Ying, please add a few positive/negative tests in FalconCLIIT and I will commit the patch.

@bvellanki Thanks for review. Since there are 10 rest apis and 10 cli commands, the IT tests for all of them will be handled in a separate jira: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FALCON-1905. I'll add both positive and negative tests there. Thanks for your reminder.
That sounds good to me. If there are no other comments from community, I will commit the patch tomorrow.
+1 - a few cleanups identified can be done later in a follow on work
+1, LGTM. Thanks for your contribution!
👍 Venkat, will commit shortly.
+1.  I was meaning developer documentation - but I understand we need to create one to keep track.   An action to take up for future :)
I have reviewed the patch, it looks good. +1.
If there are no further comments on this pull request, I will commit this soon.

We are supplying coord with action id
@PraveenAdlakha Through this issue, are you trying to rerun the entire coordinator again instead of rerunning the failed workflow. Is it possible to provide some more details.

@peeyushb, switching from workflow rerun to coord rerun was already taken care of in FALCON-1835. I have missed updating the results returned to return the coord id rather than workflow id. That is the change this PR handles
Thanks @PraveenAdlakha and @pallavi-rao  for clarification.
Patch looks good. +1 .
+1. LGTM
@PraveenAdlakha There are Falcon modules where source and target version is 1.7 for "maven-compiler-plugin". Can you just check other modules to upgrade to 1.8.
@peeyushb  have made the changes please review.
👍 Looks good to me. Please comment on end2end testing done for this Jira.
If no further comments, I will commit this patch soon.
Why do you want to disable JDK 7 support?

@vrangan Right now we are not using any code which is specific to java 8 so should not cause any problem,we can do testing for the same.

But we should migrate to java 8 as java 7 already had its end of life.Any suggestions that you have are welcome.
+1 apart from the minor nits

I have couple of comments for design doc. Sorry, I should have reviewed it when doc was provided long time. 

1> Can you talk about behavior for safe mode when the authorization is enabled & disabled?
2> Design doc says "Super user can perform update operation only on cluster entities". Shouldn't this be set safemode ON/OFF instead of cluster updates? 
3> Even the admin users/groups should be able to enable/disable safemode and not only super user
4> Doc mentions "Entity operations not allowed are : update, schedule, touch, delete, submit,
submitAndSchedule". Did you miss resume or is it allowed as its not allowed for instances.
5> In section "UI support for safemode" doesn't have the updated list of operations disallowed. Can you please update it?

Again I am sorry for the late review. Thanks!
@sowmyaramesh  : Updated the design document in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FALCON-1623
+1 LGTM
Thanks @peeyushb  for adressing comments. Patch looks good. +1
Thanks @pavankumar526 for reviewing the patch. If no further comments, I will commit this patch soon.
+1 . Looks good.
Merging the patch. Thanks @sandeepSamudrala, @peeyushb
I have verified the Falcon build using this pull request on secure cluster and it works successfully. Spark process entity runs with no issues.
@sowmyaramesh @vrangan  I updated patch to be able to persist safemode setting between restarts of falcon server. This is done based on your feedback. Please review.

Patch looks good. One general comment: You use a file to persist whether Falcon server is in safe mode or not. For long term use, looks better to have a property file to persist important runtime properties (could be a separate jira), as we may need to persist other properties in the future :)
